snippet: The ruling by the Supreme Court was a rebuke to the government and came after years of litigation over a scandal involving telecommunications licenses sold at below-market prices.
abstract: Supreme Court of India issues a rebuke to the government by canceling 122 telecommunications licenses that were sold at below-market prices in 2008 amid a corruption scandal; ruling comes after several years of litigation.

byline.contributor: Sruthi Gottipati contributed reporting from New Delhi.

lead_paragraph: The ruling by the Supreme Court was a rebuke to the government and came after years of litigation over a scandal involving telecommunications licenses sold at below-market prices.

headline.main: Indian Court Cancels Contentious Wireless Licenses
headline.print_headline: Indian Court Cancels Contentious Wireless Licenses
